I want to know about you
Tell me something about activities houses
What do you mean by cariappa
What are the four houses of this school
Describe activity houses of aps meerut
Can you tell me about houses.
responses: In order to inculcate the spirit of healthy competition a sense of collective responsibility and cooperation among the students, all competitive activities are organised on house basis. There are four houses named after four army generals. Manekshaw -> Red, Sunderji -> Blue, Cariappa -> Green, Vaidya -> Yellow

patterns: tell me about conde of conduct and discipline
responses:
Do's
1. Be on time everyday.
2. Follow proper dress code-uniform and shoes.
3. Be neat and clean.
4. Wear school uniform on all Parent-Teacher Meeting days.
5. Bring required study material to school.
6. Submit your notebook for correction on dates fixed by the teachers.
7. During the absence of the teachers from the class, obey the monitor or prefect to maintain good order.
8. Maintain exemplary behaviour and show respect for the feelings of others.
9. Be humble in your success or victory.
10. Be honest, upright and truthful.
11. Be co-operative and exhibit team spirit for positive attitude and conduct.
12. Be patient, tolerant and secular.
13. Take pride in yourself, your school, your parents and your nation.
14. Be courteous. Remember "Thank You" and "Please" are two very good words.
15. Be grateful to God for everything you have.
16. Believe in yourself and have courage. Remember God is with you always and everywhere. Don'ts
1. Do not be out of the classroom without the outpasses/written permission of the teacher concerned.
2. Do not bunk classes.
3. Do not speak foul language or scribble anywhere.
4. Do not waste water and electricity.
5. Do not copy or cheat.
6. Don't crowd in the corridors.
7. While going for games or others activities, don't move in a group, from a proper line.
8. Don't pluck flowers.
9. Don't throw garbage on floor. Always use dustbins.
10. Do not damage school property.
11. Do not look down upon those who are less priviliged, weak or physically challenged.
12. Do not hurt by your words or deeds.
13. Do not ill-treat animals or birds.
14. Do not be arrogant.
15. Do not pass racial comments.
16. Do not bring crackers, holi colours, walkman, cell phone, cameras, i-pods, MP3 players, laptops and other electronic appliances to the school. If confiscated will not be returned.
17. Don't play, run or shout in the corridors. Forbidden Practices
No student will indulge in any of the following practices:
1. Violence in any form.
2. Sex related offences.
3. Rude and disorderly behaviour.
4. Smoking
5. Use of Drugs or Intoxicants.
6. Any form of Gambling.
7. Spitting in or near the school building except in any spittoon provided by the school.
8. Casteism, communalism and practice of untouchability.
(a) No excuses or reasons will be heard for breaking the above mentioned rules.
(b) Three Yellow Slips or One Pink Slip is enough to issue a TC.
(c) Take your responsibility.

patterns: How to download NCERT Books e-book
How to download pdf of school books
how to download PDF of Books
Tell me about the dress code
Or what should I wear as school uniform?
Can I wear casual clothes in school?
What if I went school in fashionable clothes?.
What's Is the dress code for winters?
What is dress code for Summers?
What should 6th class boy wear in aps?
responses:
For Summers
Boys (1 to 8) ->
White shirt with half sleeves, Steel grey short, trousers, school belt and tie (grey and red striped) Steel grey turban for sikh students, Steel grey socks black shoes.
Boys (9 to 12) ->
White shirt with half sleeves, Steel grey trousers, school belt and tie, Steel grey turban for sikh students, Steel grey socks and black shoes.
Girls (1 to 8) ->
White shirt or blouse with half sleeves, Steel grey divided skirts (knee length compulsary) school belt and tie ( grey and red striped) Steel grey socks, plaits with red ribbon/red headband.
Girls (9 to 12) ->
Steel grey kameez (knee length) with half sleeves, white salwar, Steel grey socks, black shoes (ballerina is compulsory).
For Winters
Boys (1 to 12) ->
White shirt, dark grey trousers ,navy blue pullover, navy blue blazer, dark grey socks, black shoes, black grey turban for sikh students.
Girls (1 to 8) ->
White shirt blouse with full sleeves, dark grey skirt/trousers, navy blue pullover (V neck without collar) navy blue blazer, dark grey socks, black shoes, plates with red ribbon/red hair band.
Girls (9 to 12) ->
Dark grey kameez( knee length) with full sleeves and white salwar, white dupatta ,dark grey socks and black shoes.

responses: Tell me how can assist you
Tell me your problem to assist you
Yes Sure, How can I support you
If your dreams don't scare you, they are too small.
Mistake are proof that you are trying.
The struggle you are in today is developing the strength you need for tomorrow.
Don't let what you cannot do interfere with what you can do.
You cannot change your future, but you can change your habits, and surely your habits will change your future.
Nothing is Impossible, the word itself says 'I'm possible!'
Success is the sum of small efforts, repeated day in and day out.
Work for a Cause, not for Applause, live life to Express, not to Impress.
Don't stop when you're tired, stop when you're done.
You can never cross the ocean until you have the courage to lose sight of the shore.
Small steps in the right direction are better than the big steps in the wrong direction.
Push yourself, because no one else is going to do it for you.
You must tell yourself, 'No matter how hard it is, or how hard it gets. I'm going to make it.'
When you focus on the good, the good gets better
The secret of your future is hidden in your daily routine.
You are braver than you believe, stronger than you seem, and smarter than you think.
There is no elevator to success, you have to take the stairs.
Our greatest glory is not in falling, but in rising every time you fall.
It was a pleasure meeting you!
